title: Man arrested in Somerville fire that destroyed home under construction
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: John Grasso, 35, was arrested for destruction of property related to a fire at a Somerville construction site.
The August 20 fire destroyed a house on 75 Thurston St., damaging neighboring buildings and displacing residents.
Somerville Police and Fire Departments collaborated with the Massachusetts State Fire Marshal in Grasso's arrest.

title: Bill Belichick reportedly bans Patriots scouts from UNC practices
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick reportedly bans New England Patriots scouts from University of North Carolina practices, restricting direct observation.
Patriots scouts can request player films and contact UNC staff for prospect information despite practice access ban.
Belichick's relationship with Patriots owner Robert Kraft has been strained since leaving the team after the 2023 season.

title: Mass. schools placed in lockdown due to hunter with unloaded gun, police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Upton Police locked down two schools due to reports of a man with a gun near Nipmuc High and Blackstone Valley Technical.
The suspect, later identified as a hunter with an unloaded firearm, was returning to his car after legally hunting.
Schools were released from lockdown after police confirmed there was no threat; community cooperation was praised by authorities.

title: Missing daughter of Worcester mother in ICE detention found, police say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: The 13-year-old daughter of Rosane Ferreira De Oliveira, in ICE custody, was found safe and is back with DCF.
The 17-year-old daughter, Nayara Ferreira De Moura, remains missing; last seen in Lancaster, reportedly in Brazil.
Ferreira De Oliveira was arrested in May, allegedly lured by ICE using her grandchild, leading to community protests.

title: Here’s what to know about the HHS demand that Mass. erase ‘gender ideology’ from sex ed materials
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: The Trump administration demands Massachusetts remove 'gender ideology' references from federally funded sex ed materials.
Massachusetts has 60 days to revise materials or risk losing up to $2.36 million in federal funding.
U.S. Department of Health and Human Services identifies problematic references to gender identity and expression in materials.

title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão appointed as inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC, leaves Portuguese club Benfica.
Patão aims to create a legacy with Boston, aligning with general manager Domènec Guasch from Barcelona.
Patão acclimates to Boston life, trying local lobster rolls and noting the city's sports passion.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman enters the 2025-26 NHL season with a cleared contract situation after last year's contentious negotiations.
Swayman struggled last season post-contract dispute, posting a career-low .892 save percentage with the Bruins.
A strong World Championship performance and full participation in training camp have rejuvenated Swayman for the upcoming season.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels, Patriots' offensive coordinator, will face his former team, the Raiders, in Sunday's home opener.
McDaniels, previously head coach for the Raiders with a 9-16 record, expresses no ill will towards them.
New Patriots players Drake Maye and Stefon Diggs will be key in McDaniels' offensive strategy against the Raiders.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks will star and executive produce a Prime Video series about Karen Read's murder case.
The series, developed by Warner Bros Television, explores true crime obsession and institutional trust issues.
A Boston.com poll showed 48% support Banks' casting, with readers suggesting other actresses like Anne Hathaway.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun in Uncasville, Conn., ranked No. 2 in USA Today's list of best non-Vegas casinos.
Foxwoods Resort Casino in Mashantucket, Conn., was ranked No. 3 by USA Today readers.
Mohegan Sun also ranked No. 1 for slots and No. 2 for best casino hotel nationwide.
